top_categories.workout_context: Bend Dirt Fest’s high desert gravel roads, doubletrack demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Bend Dirt Fest isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Bend Dirt Fest rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Bend Dirt Fest’s high desert gravel + singletrack and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Bend Dirt Fest’s high desert gravel + singletrack drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Bend Dirt Fest when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Bend Dirt Fest. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Bend Dirt Fest — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Bend Dirt Fest — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on high desert gravel + singletrack.
The varied gradients at Bend Dirt Fest reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Bend Dirt Fest’s high desert gravel + singletrack delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Bend Dirt Fest — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Bend Dirt Fest’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Bend Dirt Fest. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Bend Dirt Fest requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high desert gravel + singletrack to build confidence. Expect: high desert gravel roads, doubletrack, singletrack mix.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 50 miles of high desert gravel + singletrack in Bend, Oregon.
